data.title: 5 business ventures owned by Elton Brand
data.meta_description: Elton Brand spread his influence beyond the court to the realm of business with companies like Human Ventures, Gibraltar Films amongst others.
data.text:
665

Elton Brand’s rise in basketball began at Peekskill High School, where he was consistently ranked among the top high school basketball players in the country, helping his team win two state championships and was selected as New York State Mr. Basketball, resulting in a remarkable tenure at Duke University, where his performance earned him National Player of the Year and led to his selection as the first overall pick by the Chicago Bulls in 1999. His NBA career spanned 17 years across five teams, highlighted by achievements such as two NBA All-Star selections and the All-NBA Second Team in 2006.

Transitioning off the court, Brand took on the role of general manager for the Philadelphia 76ers after serving as the Player Development Consultant for the 76ers and General Manager of the Delaware 87ers, maximising his extensive experience in basketball management. Moreover, his journey reflects a deep commitment to the sport of basketball, from dominating the college circuit to influencing the future of professional basketball through executive leadership, showcasing his multifaceted legacy in the sport.

HUMBLE VENTURES

Humble Ventures, where Elton Brand has been involved, operates with an inclusive approach to venture capital. It focuses on diverse founders, entrepreneurs, start-ups, and organizations, with a mindset to support innovation and growth across various sectors. Also, Elton Brand is listed as a co-founder of Humble Ventures. However, the firm’s approach to venture capital is characterized by a focus on diversity and inclusion, aiming to support and collaborate with startups, enterprises, and investors from varied backgrounds to foster innovation and growth across multiple sectors.

GIBRALTAR FILMS

Gibraltar Films, co-founded by Elton Brand, is a production company that invests in, acquires, produces, and distributes cinematic films. The company’s first project was “Rescue Dawn,” released in 2007, directed by Werner Herzog and based on the survival story of a U.S. pilot captured in a Vietnam prison. Moreover, Gibraltar Films represents Brand’s venture into the film industry, reflecting his interest in supporting and creating meaningful cinematic projects beyond his professional sports and venture capital endeavors​​.

MILK MEDIA STUDIOS

Milk & Media Studios, established in 2009 by Elton Brand and Harry Knapp, originated from their successful collaboration on the film “Rescue Dawn,” starring Christian Bale. The studio engages in producing a diverse order of content including films, television shows, commercials, and digital content, demonstrating Brand’s broad interests in the entertainment industry beyond his basketball and investment endeavors.

KB PARTNERS

Elton Brand is listed among the investors in KB Partners’ Myriad Opportunity Fund II, an early stage venture capital fund which focuses on investing in sports technology startups. As at 2021, the Myriad Opportunity Fund II fund had secured $64 million toward its goal with contributions from notable figures like NFL Hall of Fame running back Curtis Martin and Callaway Golf CEO Chip Brewer, alongside Brand.
